title: PM Office establishes Internal Affairs Unit for corruption-free public service
byline: An Internal Affairs Unit at the Prime Minister’s Office has been officially established at Temple Trees under the leadership of Secretary to the Prime Minister, Pradeep Saputhanthri, the Office of the Prime Minister said.

title: Muslims in Sri Lanka celebrating Hajj festival today
byline: Muslims in Sri Lanka are celebrating the Hajj festival today.

title: US brings man mistakenly deported to El Salvador back to face charges
byline: Kilmar Ábrego García, a 29-year-old from El Salvador who was mistakenly deported in March, has been returned to the US to face prosecution on two federal criminal charges.

title: Hajj embodies unity by bridging divisions and fostering brotherhood- President
byline: The essence of Hajj lies in bridging divisions and fostering universal brotherhood, offering a powerful example of unity, says President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Showery conditions to enhance in south-western part of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showery conditions are expected to enhance in the southwestern part of the island from June 10th, with strong gusty winds expected over the island and in the sea areas around the island.

title: Hajj serves as an example for all humanity - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, in her message marking the occasion of Hajj and Eid al-Adha, extended greetings to Muslim devotees in Sri Lanka and around the world, highlighting the importance of unity, coexistence, and devotion that define this sacred time.

title: Biggest drone strike yet on Ukraine’s second city
byline: At least two people have been killed and another 17 injured in the biggest Russian drone attack on Ukraine’s second-largest city of Kharkiv, the mayor says.

title: Lost Turner oil painting found after 150 years
byline: The first oil painting ever exhibited by Turner is to be put up for auction after being lost for more 150 years.

title: National Poson Week begins today
byline: The National Poson Week begins today (June 7).

title: Supplementary Medical Professionals: Four unions withdraw from strike
byline: The strike initiated by the Joint Council for Professions Supplementary to Medicine (JCPSM) concluded at 8:00 a.m. today (June 7), with four out of its five affiliated unions deciding to call off the industrial action.

title: PMD issues statement on alleged presidential pardon of prisoner
byline: The President’s Media Division (PMD) has issued an official statement highlighting a serious procedural irregularity involving the release of a prisoner from Anuradhapura Prison, who was not approved under the presidential pardon granted for the 2025 Vesak festival.

title: Trouble for Sinopec oil refinery in Hambantota Port – report
byline: The proposed $3.7 million oil refinery to be built by China’s Sinopec in Sri Lanka’s Hambantota port is facing significant delays over multiple issues like dispute over equity structure, tax concessions, market access, and allocation of land for the project.

title: Dengue cases surge past 6,000 in Sri Lanka in May as monsoon season begins
byline: A total of 6,042 cases of dengue was reported from Sri Lanka in May, the latest data by the National Dengue Control Unit (NDCU) shows.

title: Film festival showcases what artificial intelligence can do on the big screen
byline: Artificial intelligence ’s use in movie making is exploding. And a young film festival, now in its junior year, is showcasing what this technology can do on screen today.

title: Ambassador Jayantha Jayasuriya presents credentials to UN Secretary-General
byline: Ambassador Jayantha Jayasuriya has presented his Letters of Credence as the Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to the United Nations, to the Secretary-General of the United Nations António Guterres at a solemn ceremony held at the United Nations Headquarters in New York.

title: New ‘Game of Thrones’ PC strategy game ‘War for Westeros’ to launch in 2026
byline: A new video game set during the events of HBO’s “Game of Thrones” is set to launch in 2026 from PlaySide Studios and Warner Bros. Interactive.

title: Transport associations call for stakeholder discussions prior to new regulations
byline: Transport associations across Sri Lanka have urged the government to initiate discussions with stakeholders before implementing new regulations concerning private buses, three-wheelers, and vehicles used for transporting schoolchildren.

title: Canada’s Carney invites India’s Modi to June G7 summit in Canada
byline: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney invited his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi to the upcoming Group of Seven summit in a phone call on Friday, as the two sides look to mend ties after relations soured in the past two years.

title: Several schools in Anuradhapura closed during Poson festival
byline: The Provincial Department of Education in North Central Province, has announced that several schools in the Anuradhapura area will remain closed from today until June 12 in observance of National Poson Week.
